Package fr.ens.biologie.codeGeneration

Class ClassGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.ens.biologie.codeGeneration.ClassGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JavaCode
    public class ClassGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements JavaCode

    A simple java class generator. It can generate almost any standard class code, as long as there are no inner classes.

    Usage:

    1. Get an instance of this class. This will require some basic information about the class to generate (e.g. superclass, package, methods to override...).
    2. Adapt the generator to your needs by adding methods, constructors, fields, etc., using methods defined here.
    3. When all this is finished, call asText() to generate a String that can be saved as a java source file.

    You should then check that the generated code, saved as a source file, properly compiles using a JavaCompiler

    Author:
    Jacques Gignoux - 19 d√©c. 2014
    See Also:
    MethodGenerator

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClassGenerator

        public ClassGenerator​(java.lang.String packageName,
                      java.lang.String classComment,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      boolean isInterface,
                      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> methodsToOverride,
                      java.lang.String superclass,
                      java.lang.String... interfaces)
        Constructor. The default behaviour is to generate method bodies only for methods declared abstract in the superclass or interfaces. To generate a body for a concrete or default method, pass its name in arg methodsToOverride (otherwise methodsToOverride can safely be set to null).
        Parameters:
        packageName - the package of the class to create
        classComment - the class file comment
        name - the class name
        isInterface - true if the class to generate is an interface
        methodsToOverride - the list of methods to override if different from abstract methods
        superclass - the superclass
        interfaces - the interfaces

        this class for agile programming

      • getConstructor

        public MethodGenerator getConstructor​(java.lang.String key)
        Retrieves a declared constructor by its key. NB constructor keys are Strings of the form "constructor1", "constructor2", etc. where the number is the order in which they were declared (i.e. 1 is the first constructor you added).
        Parameters:
        key - the constructor key
        Returns:
        the constructor generator

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this class for agile programming

      • setRawMethodCode

        public ClassGenerator setRawMethodCode​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> snippet)
        Inserts raw code lines. These lines will be inserted verbatim in the class, with no indentation. You can use this to implement private methods, typically, or code copied from external sources.
        Parameters:
        snippet - the lines to insert
        Returns:
        this class for agile programming

      • asText

        public java.lang.String asText​(java.lang.String indent)
        Description copied from interface: JavaCode
        Constructs and returns valid java code as a plain text String. The returned String is assumed to contain lines separated by end-of-line characters so that it can be directly saved to a .java code file.
        Specified by:
        asText in interface JavaCode
        Parameters:
        indent - the String to use for indentation of code lines
        Returns:
        the code as a single String
